content:
I have just realized that "Lean 4 survival guide for Lean 3 users" exists. Nice! I wish I had known about it sooner.

I noticed that the section "Specific tactic changes"
https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/wiki/Lean-4-survival-guide-for-Lean-3-users#specific-tactic-changes
contains a link to my cheat sheet:
https://github.com/madvorak/lean4-cheatsheet
I think it should rather link to my other reference sheet:
https://github.com/madvorak/lean3-tactic-lean4
The latter is designed for Lean 3 users.
it's a wiki so feel free to correct any mistakes / add things you feel are missing. Probably both references should be linked, right?

I think I don't have rights to edit the wiki (I don't see any "Edit" button).
Regarding the change, I'd vote for a replacement rather the addition.
The relevant link for this page is:
https://github.com/madvorak/lean3-tactic-lean4
Do you have write access to mathlib4? I would assume that gives you write access to the wiki...
Martin Dvořák has marked this topic as resolved.
